programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders go to Santa Cruz for one of the most hotly anticipated auctions of the year.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team has a chance to buy what is claimed to be an authentic bullwhip used in an Indiana Jones film, and handles a document dating from colonial times, signed by 18th-century American statesman John Hancock.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers consider buying their first aeroplane, and scrutinise a map of colonial Boston, unsure whether it is counterfeit. Elsewhere, Rick Harrison is unimpressed when Chumlee purchases a piece of fake art.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The price of gold begins to fall, and the staff worry that they could end up losing money. Les, Seth and Ashley become more conscious of what items they buy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les offers to buy a diamond-encrusted watch from a customer. He makes sure his jewellery expert takes a close look, having been stung by a similar deal previously.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick tries to mend a rare 1940s vacuum cleaner that has fallen to pieces.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team works on a vending machine for bowling equipment and an antique copper pest sprayer.

programme.title: Motives & Murders
programme.desc: Detectives crack a 32-year-old murder case using a novel technique involving a deck of cards, finally bringing an assassin to justice.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: When an arrest is made in the contract killing of a California businessman, police discover that is just the beginning of the story.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: An auction in Mesquite brings back bad memories for Ricky and Bubba, and Mary makes a strange discovery that leads her to a llama farm.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Things get hairy in Henderson when an impromptu brawl breaks out among some of the bidders.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick sets the team a challenge when Kelly organises a car show at the shop. The team also works on restoring a famous railway sign.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick sends his staff to a famous street market, and expects them to come back with something special. A client brings a rare 1930s telephone box into the workshop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is unsure about the authenticity of an 1861 American Civil War sabre, complete with bloodstain. Rick is stumped when a customer brings in a native American totem, and Corey bets the Old Man that he can sell a Rolex watch for $4,800

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey is forced to admit his mistake after buying a 1984 Chris-Craft boat without testing it. An elderly man brings in an 1849 Colt revolver that he forgot to unload, and there is an opportunity for the staff to buy a rare 1954 Gretsch guitar formerly owned by Robert Duvall.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Experts investigate military bunkers in the US where, according to some, living extraterrestrials are being hidden.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Scientists explore the possibility that sightings of alien beings or UFOs may actually be evidence of time travellers from the future.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The price of gold continues to drop. Seth suggests they should review their purchases, and sort out the cluttered sales floor, along with a warehouse overloaded with junk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth is angered when Les dismisses the consultant's suggestions about improving business practices. Seth disappears, and his manager fears he may be on the verge of quitting.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is embarrassed when a woman tries to sell her husband's Playboy collection, and Corey considers buying a crossbow that has not been fired in almost 40 years.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers are tempted to buy a 1979 Kiss pinball machine, and Rick is stumped when a woman brings in a 1914 $20 bill with an unusual serial number. Chumlee tries to scrape together the cash to purchase a classic Harley-Davidson Shovel-head motorbike before the Old Man sells it.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi discover a secret in San Francisco, while Darrell takes a gamble that could cost him everything.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell hopes that his instincts will put him back in profit, while Dave has trouble finding anything worth bidding for.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny makes a series of extravagant bids to come out on top at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Veteran locker bidder Puffy - who also happens to be Ricky's mother - causes a commotion when she competes in a storage battle in upscale Haslet.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths are tasked with forging blades out of steel from a chain and a sprocket. Only two secure a spot in the final round to recreate the iconic Karabela sabre.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick Harrison splashes out on the Mafia favourite, a 1962 Lincoln Continental with 'suicide doors', but extensive repair bills cause tension between him and the old man. A customer brings in a billfold from 1857 filled with Confederate money he found while cleaning out his garage, and the staff have a chance to buy a guitar that was played at a birthday party for Al Capone.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Old Man looks to buy a baseball signed by 1951 World Series Champions the New York Yankees, but first needs to verify its authenticity. The team also appraises a rare $20 bill, a stuntman's driving suit, a piano and a KISS pinball table, while Chumlee is delighted when a Harley-Davidson is brought into the shop.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the truth about UFOs, investigating whether a covert manual could prove the US government is hiding extra-terrestrial secrets.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists investigate a depiction of a stegosaurus found at Angkor Wat in Cambodia, comtemplating whether it suggest that alien species killed off the dinosaurs.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les confronts Seth after finding out that he was at Bill's pawn shop. He asks some blunt questions about why he would betray the family by visiting a rival store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: On the last day of the Dream Cruise, Les buys what is claimed to be the world's largest fishing lure - reportedly an art piece saluting Michigan - for $3,000

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders head to Torrance and compete over an unusual unit that may prove to be one of the most valuable in the series' history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: At auctions in Bellflower, Ivy prays he can salvage something from a bad purchase. Meanwhile, Jarrod buys a unit that proves a nightmare for Brandi..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team considers buying a mysterious 17th-century treasure chest that no one has yet managed to open.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff are offered an aeroplane propeller linked to aviator Charles Lindbergh, and a key ring alleged to have belonged to singer Willie Nelson.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: A UFO Spotted Over the Pentagon and More
programme.desc: Footage of a pyramid-shaped UFO over the Pentagon, a spook haunting a playground, and strange creatures stalking California.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts investigate evidence of spirits and frightening paranormal encounters, questioning whether ghosts and poltergeists exist or are a figment of wild imagination.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi discover a secret in San Francisco, while Darrell takes a gamble that could cost him everything.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell hopes that his instincts will put him back in profit, while Dave has trouble finding anything worth bidding for.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Tom Allen, Felicity Ward, Sue Perkins and Alex Brooker are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain presents a special compilation show featuring previously unbroadcast material, out-takes and favourite bits from the recent series of the satirical comedy quiz, when regular panellists Andy Parsons and Hugh Dennis were joined by guests including Josh Widdicombe, Miles Jupp, Holly Walsh and Rob Beckett. From 2014.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack return with previously unseen material from the latest run of the comedy panel show. Featuring appearances by guests including David Baddiel, Ed Balls, Jo Brand, Steve Davis, Susie Dent, Ade Edmondson, Sheila Hancock, Stephen Mangan, Bob Mortimer, Ore Oduba, Anita Rani, Fay Ripley, Stacey Solomon, Jordan Stephens, Claudia Winkleman and Kimberly Wyatt.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Micky Flanagan, Fiona Bruce, Claudia Winkleman and Steve Jones are first up, with stories including performing a striptease at a lacklustre hen party and saving P Diddy from drowning.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: Two company directors are at loggerheads thanks to an unusual kind of bird, and two friends seek the Romesh's ruling after a rude prank.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: Shaun Ryder and Bez from the Happy Mondays are locked in a clash over cash, and two twin sisters come to court and end up catching the eye of Bailiff Tom.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain presents a special compilation show featuring previously unbroadcast material, out-takes and favourite bits from the recent series of the satirical comedy quiz, when regular panellists Andy Parsons and Hugh Dennis were joined by guests including Josh Widdicombe, Miles Jupp, Holly Walsh and Rob Beckett. From 2014.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Thanks to back flips and rail rides, Tim and Gendle are in BMX bike heaven. With the clock ticking it is down to Joe and the build team to construct the ultimate BMX set-up.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Rookie Bodycam Cop Laura heads out to make her first arrest as a newly qualified police officer and James is called to a disturbance on a quiet residential street.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A lead on an ultra-rare VW Beetle turns out to be a true barn find, but it will take a heavy metal move to bring it home.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders in Essex battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are in Alton, Hampshire, where Linda is concerned that the other bidders are taking advantage of her superior knowledge and her looks. Meanwhile, Boudicca and Heavy D form more than just a business partnership, and Barry impresses with his dainty footwork.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: A look at the top 12 big-ticket items that Mike and Frank picked in previous shows.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank look back at their best picks from the 1960s, including a meeting with Captain Kirk and a seat in the original Batmobile.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Police officers request a new police support unit or riot van, while a stolen car chase ends with an X5 wedged in a hedge. Boss Mick Sweetmore goes back to the floor with Merseyside's mental health team and discovers another side to modern-day policing - as well as the poor state of the vehicle they are currently using.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson test-drives two estate cars - the BMW M5 and Mercedes E63. Richard Hammond tries out motor-home racing, while James May pits an Alfa Romeo 159 against a man who crosses the Humber estuary without using its famous bridge. The Stig puts Honda's Civic Type R through its paces and former England rugby union forward Lawrence Dallaglio is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Two young men are stabbed outside a fast-food restaurant. The police catch the suspects, and one is upset at the prospect of surrendering his trainers at custody.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve agrees to build a crazy 1970s-era gasser racecar for a US Navy veteran and tries to make money by restoring and flipping a Prohibition-era bootlegger Model A truck.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an edition first broadcast in 2007, Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May celebrate British Leyland's 40th birthday by trying to boost the reputation of the cars that once rolled off its production line. The Aston Martin DBS is put through its paces on the test track, Jennifer Saunders is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car and the team asks whatever happened to the beach buggy.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Motor racing driver Lewis Hamilton demonstrates his abilities on the test track, and Richard Hammond tries his hand in a Formula One car. Jeremy Clarkson and James May assess historic vehicles to establish which one pioneered the control layout used in modern cars, and singer-songwriter James Blunt is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig considers the subjects of pain and punishment, with guests Jimmy Carr, Lee Mack and Alice Levine joining regular Alan Davies on the panel.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Chizzy Akudolu, Charlie Higson, Kate Williams and Tom Allen go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games across the week.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Strictly judge Bruno Tonioli, Newsnight presenter Kirsty Wark and comedians Adam Buxton and Rob Beckett are this week's guests.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Bake Off presenter Mel Giedroyc, comedian Bob Mortimer, Citizen Khan star Adil Ray and Westlife singer Kian Egan are this week's guests, whose stories include licking David Bowie's cake and being ordered to leave town by the police.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Phill Jupitus, Cally Beaton and Rhod Gilbert join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an unconventional look at a potpourri of topics, while facing some impossible questions. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Angela Barnes, Guz Khan, Tom Davis and Harriet Kemsley are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Strictly judge Bruno Tonioli, Newsnight presenter Kirsty Wark and comedians Adam Buxton and Rob Beckett are this week's guests.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts a 2011 edition of the comedy quiz, as stand-ups Milton Jones and Seann Walsh, The Thick of It's Chris Addison and Greg Davies from The Inbetweeners join panellists Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to offer opinions on the past week's world events.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright attends a former customer's funeral, leaving Granville in charge of the store. However, the miserly shopkeeper has difficulty trusting his nephew to run it properly.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Heinrich Himmler, the book-loving loner whose strange mystical beliefs drove him to carry out the most shocking act of genocide in human history.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Since their meteoric rise in the 19th Century, railways have been at the forefront of modern engineering. They've conquered dizzying altitudes, wilderness, seas and cities..

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: The spies who worked during the American Civil War, including Elizabeth van Lew, whose effective network even smuggled out messages in hollow eggs.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Since their rise in the 19th century, railways have been at the forefront of modern engineering and transport, conquering dizzying altitudes, wilderness, seas and cities.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Real Ark of the Covenant
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston goes in search of the location of the real Ark of the Covenant, believed to be held in a chapel in Ethiopia that is now in dire need of repair.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's former deputy Hermann Goering, who emerged from house arrest in May 1945 and made his way to American lines in the hope of surrendering to them rather than the Russians. After being imprisoned at Nuremberg, he committed suicide by poisoning in October 1946.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Heinrich Himmler, the book-loving loner whose strange mystical beliefs drove him to carry out the most shocking act of genocide in human history.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Incredible feats of human endeavour, revealing what people have built, where they've built it, how and why. The first edition explores deep inside the rock on Gibraltar where there's over 55km complex of tunnels, under London, where 21st-century engineering innovation is paving the way for the ultimate super sewer and continues the legacy of Victorian pioneers and reveals the extraordinary subterranean space of one of Europe's largest and most breath-taking natural cave systems - The Postojna Cave in Slovenia.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The wilderness lines that have pushed the frontiers of human endeavour into previously unknown territories, solving a set of complex problems along the way.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: As the deadline approaches for the reopening of the mainline at Dawlish, a 300-strong army of engineers works 24 hours a day to keep to the timetable. At London's Paddington station, a train with a Pullman silver service dining car is being prepared, with the onboard team pulling out all the stops to impress food writer Regula Ysewijn, who is researching an article. Elsewhere, North Cotswolds station manager Theresa - known as the 'smiling tiger' for the way she runs her stations firmly and with great care and dedication - keeps a watchful eye on the line between Oxford and Hereford, which carries the highest proportion of first-class ticket holders on the network.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Incredible feats of human endeavour, revealing what people have built, where they've built it, how and why. The first edition explores deep inside the rock on Gibraltar where there's over 55km complex of tunnels, under London, where 21st-century engineering innovation is paving the way for the ultimate super sewer and continues the legacy of Victorian pioneers and reveals the extraordinary subterranean space of one of Europe's largest and most breath-taking natural cave systems - The Postojna Cave in Slovenia.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How railway engineers have crossed valleys, canyons and waterways, including the Forth Bridge and a viaduct in rural New Zealand.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The capture and subsequent suicide of Heinrich Himmler. One of Hitler's most feared allies, his earlier reign of persecution had resulted in the deaths of millions of people.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Albert Speer, the apolitical architect whose desire to build grand buildings led him to sell his soul.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at Sweden's passion for subterranean spaces and how this nation has taken extraordinary precautions to protect itself - by excavating an astounding 65,000 nuclear bunkers. In south-west England, deep in the Mendip Hills of Somerset, lies one of the most spectacular landscapes in the UK, but beneath this breath-taking landscape sits secret caverns and magical rock formations carved out by nature. Plus, how in Romania, nside a 1.2km-thick layer of salt, sits a world underground first.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: New York Architect Wendy Fok travels to the remote Guizhou Valley in China to see the Beipanjiang First Bridge, the highest bridge on Earth, which boasts a 20,000 tonne steel deck. She soon discovers that trying to straddle a 565 metre gorge so deep that it's known as the 'crack in the Earth', presented huge challenges for its engineers. Plus, Andrew Steele tracks down a bridge on the thames that nobody thought could ever be built, Suzie Sheehy is in Hampshire climbing the tallest unreinforced concrete town ever built and Luke Bisby scales the Forth Bridge in Edinburgh.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Following a break-in, Arkwright decides to buy a guard dog to keep away potential burglars. Unfortunately, his new investment also scares off the customers.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright attends a former customer's funeral, leaving Granville in charge of the store. However, the miserly shopkeeper has difficulty trusting his nephew to run it properly.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How railway engineers have crossed valleys, canyons and waterways, including the Forth Bridge and a viaduct in rural New Zealand.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The body of a prostitute found in a river makes Ross realise an old adversary is importing girls from overseas to work in the vice trade. Unfortunately, his impetuous handling of the case puts others in danger and threatens to bring his career to an ignominious end - until he redeems himself with some quick thinking that gives the team a vital lead. Drama, starring Blythe Duff, John Michie and Colin McCredie.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a body is found half-buried in a swamp. Visiting her home, Wallander discovers signs of an intruder and that the dead woman's daughter is missing. The return of a lost love distracts him from the case at hand, as he encounters a gang of bikers that have been causing trouble in the area and begins to suspect he is being watched.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward returns to Barton House in Warwickshire to talk to its owners about the work involved in creating their 12-acre site, which is opening for a few days as part of the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The Tuckers get to grips with the prospect of parenthood, and while Dave is delighted at the thought of being a father, Donna is terrified.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Major Cochrane is charged with the attempted rape of the daughter of an influential businessman. Elsewhere, rivalry surfaces between the men and women during a dragon boat race.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Andrea's cover has been well and truly blown, leaving her to face the wrath of Gina and fatally compromising her testimony at the trial of rapist Alan Kennedy, who is acquitted. Desperate for a chance to redeem herself, she makes one last effort to gather incriminating evidence against Gabriel - only to end up being held hostage in a store room by the crazed copper. Events come to a head when Colin is dismissed after being exposed as a vicious racist and retaliates by handcuffing Ken in a petrol-doused van and crashing it into Sun Hill's front office. Blissfully unaware of the escalating crisis, Reg calls Marilyn's mobile phone at the station, intending to ask for her hand in marriage - and triggers a massive explosion.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Medical drama series charting life on the wards of Holby City Hospital.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The nursing staff undergo self-defence training, but Charlie needs a softly-softly approach to rescue Baz from a gun-toting kidnapper. With Holby A&E accepting emergencies only, Richard plans a career move and paramedic Josh considers adopting Liam until Penny questions his motives.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An inferno sweeps through Sun Hill station in the aftermath of the explosion, giving Gabriel the chance to make good his escape, callously leaving Andrea trapped under fallen debris as the flames creep closer. Dale also faces a fiery demise in the burning building, while Jim struggles to accept the news that his friend Ken was killed instantly when the van blew up. Marilyn fights for life in hospital, a grief-stricken Reg at her bedside - and as he tearfully slips an engagement ring onto her finger, an ominous bleep from her cardiac monitor heralds a tragic end to their relationship.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle suggests a girls' night out with Sharon at her college, but the evening ends in disaster when Grant and Clyde turn up.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Clyde hears some unpleasant home truths from Michelle, and a confession rocks Sharon and Grant's marriage.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch come to the rescue of an old firefighter. Colin's probation period ends. The team also tackle a blaze in the attic of a house. Starring Steve North.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie's wayward sister Lizzie turns up with her New Age guru boyfriend Gerald, and tries to convert Glenbogle into a healing centre. Katrina is furious that the well in her garden has dried up, and gamekeeper Golly loses his knack of wooing the opposite sex. Richard Briers and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A visiting athlete provokes confusion on the island - especially as he appears to be linked with Philippa Vale. Jim, Charlie and a hitman find themselves running around in circles before order is restored, and a mystery surrounding Valley Farm is solved. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian is arrested while riding his bicycle, and the family decides to keep Pa Boswell's health problems a secret from him.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Ted gets up to his usual tricks, using every money-raising fiddle in the book to fend off bailiffs threatening him with prison for failing to pay maintenance to his ex-wife. Paul Shane and Simon Cadell star in Jimmy Perry and David Croft's holiday camp comedy.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean return from a weekend away to find Judith's boyfriend has been staying at the house. To add to their woes, Alistair announces he has got engaged to a girl named Mercury - dashing their hopes of his ever becoming their son-in-law. Comedy starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: A Short Introduction to Cooper's Rules
programme.desc: Local PCs Cooper and Walsh try to master a new crime-fighting technique. However, the duo's carefully laid plans unravel when Barry decides to treat a retired vicar to a day trip. Long-running sitcom, starring Ken Kitson and Louis Emerick.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: DCI Adams' investigations into a spate of domestic robberies result in an accusation of sexual harassment against him from a young nurse. Hetty is convinced he has been wrongly accused and investigates the claim from her hospital bed.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: When their lead suspect is murdered in a laboratory, Peregrine and James are forced to admit that their killer's motives go far deeper than they had both dared to consider.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A man wrongly convicted of burning down a school is released, and seeks Halford's help in tracking down the culprit. Standing meets a woman who claims to be his daughter (played by Dennis Waterman's real-life daughter Hannah) but Lane is not convinced she is telling the truth. Pullman is offered a promotion to head of the Murder Squad. Kevin Whately and Joe Absalom guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Investigating the mysterious death of a youngster at an elite Glasgow school, Burke incurs the wrath of the local press and finds himself branded a bully for his rough tactics. Ross goes undercover and soon discovers links with the shady world of drug-dealing. Drama, starring Blythe Duff and Alex Norton.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky Midnight News
programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Ian King Live
programme.desc: All the day's business news live from Sky's City of London studio, with Ian King.

programme.title: Tyson Fury: The Gypsy King
programme.desc: The heavyweight celebrates a victory over Thomas Schwartz in Las Vegas by enjoying a night of heavy drinking back home in Morecambe and video-calling rival Anthony Joshua. This angers his wife Paris, who is reminded of his alcohol abuse during his years of depression, and Fury looks to make amends by treating the family to a day out in Blackpool and booking a family holiday. The boxer then heads to Marbella with trainer Ben Davison, before preparing to face his next opponent Otto Wallin back in Vegas, in what proves to be a challenging fight.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The celebrated chef arrives in Burgundy, a region famous for its wines and mustard fields. Retracing Keith Floyd's visit 30 years ago, James stops at the same vineyard for a personal tour. He also visits the region's Capital, Dijon, turning his hand to making the city's more famous export - mustard.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features. Presented by Susannah Reid and Bill Turnbull.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis. A team of five from Holyhead take on the Tenable Tower as they attempt to win a 125,000 prize. Can they score a Perfect 10 to bring home the money?.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Dani, Chris, Bernie and Martin pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon sobs in his prison cell, Doug makes a decision and Arthur feels betrayed, while Jai is happy when Laurel moves in for a kiss.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Kevin confesses to Tyrone that he's being blackmailed by Ray, Gemma attends a baby senses class with the quads, and Peter calls at No.1 with the intention of telling Ken that he no longer wants the house.

programme.title: Harry Redknapp's Sandbanks Summer
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp welcomes celebrity friends to his house in Sandbanks, Britain's most exclusive and expensive seaside resort. In this episode, Harry welcomes John Barnes and Chris Kamara, where they take to the water to see what the area has to offer from the sea. Harry challenges John and Chris to a powerboat showdown on the Solent, before they sample a local delicacy at Harry's favourite chip shop.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Sarah implores Bethany not to let her feelings for Daniel stand in the way of her career, Vanessa suggests Gemma should come to her baby yoga class, and Tyrone is furious with Kevin for putting their business in jeopardy to help Abi.

programme.title: Flesh and Blood
programme.desc: The children's ongoing distrust starts to put a strain on Vivien and Mark's relationship. Meanwhile, Natalie struggles deal with her situation with Tony, and Jake turns to Stella for advice. Later, Jake unearths a darkly disturbing secret about Mark's past. Starring Francesca Annis, Imelda Staunton and Stephen Rea.

programme.desc: Make way for the unapologetically unique Yungblud, as we discover the must-have rock acts on his rider - with big ones from Paramore, Green Day & Blink 182, plus some of his own.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The processes used to turn used aluminium cans into planes and rockets. Plus, the way in which a traditional Black Forest cuckoo clock is carved.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a rare, rust-free model of a Datsun 240Z California and Edd China swaps the auto for manual transmission, before the pair try to make a profit.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Road flooding means Mark and his crew must work against the clock to deliver a fragile load to a remote gold mine. And, Jeff faces a treacherous pass in wet conditions.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team puts the finishing touches to the National Guard bike built to honour American troops, and presents the completed machine to its new owners.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Kansas City Royals pitcher Tim Collins wants a super-fast 1968 Mustang. However, Dan first has to undo a combination of bad repairs.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: The intrepid Mike Rowe takes on a succession of less than pleasant tasks, each involving a certain amount of grime and discomfort.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Rally Cars/Pork Pies/Floating Fountains/Ornaments Made of Artificial Stone
programme.desc: The development of rally cars, pork pies, floating fountains and ornaments made of artificial stone.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Developments in the manufacture of cufflinks, dashboards, blueberry turnovers and earthenware pottery.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Examining how the world's finest harp strings are made, how they build roof windows that can keep out a hurricane, and how to make Belgian waffles.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Just outside Washington DC, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a stash of untouched inventory from one of the US' oldest bicycle and sporting goods store.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The king crab season draws to a close, and the crews are annoyed to discover large numbers of stinging jellyfish in the crab pots.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: Zeke takes a gamble on a new dredger, while Emily struggles under her father's management.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Road flooding means Mark and his crew must work against the clock to deliver a fragile load to a remote gold mine. And, Jeff faces a treacherous pass in wet conditions.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China restore a Porsche 924 in an attempt to make it roadworthy again.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China continue their project to make a classic Porsche 924 fit for the road.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini meets a woman who asks him to sell a Chevrolet that belonged to her husband and that has not been driven for years.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini checks out a classic Bimbo racer. He likes the vehicle, but it needs a lot of work and its present owner is driving a hard bargain.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Just outside Washington DC, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a stash of untouched inventory from one of the US' oldest bicycle and sporting goods store.

programme.title: Railroad Alaska
programme.desc: The documentary series following the construction crews, mechanics and train drivers battling to keep a 500-mile long railroad in Alaska open through extreme weather returns. The freight crew struggles to make a delivery to a salvage team stranded in the wilderness, and Jim James has a surprise for Nancy.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: As the crab season draws to a close, the Northwestern's exhausted crew fills the ship's storage tanks to the brim, and Wizard and Time Bandit compete for 'String of the Week'.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: Scott's dredge is literally running on fumes. Meanwhile, cocky newcomer Glen clashes with Zeke over how to best run the dredge. But who will get the last word.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard meets an Oxfordshire aristocrat who owns his own steam train, and picks up an American sign and a Victorian oil lamp.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Deep in cattle country, Anthony and Danielle tackle an urgent water-drilling job to replace a collapsed well. Plus, a cross country convoy of drag racing cars is off to Perth.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a rare, rust-free model of a Datsun 240Z California and Edd China swaps the auto for manual transmission, before the pair try to make a profit.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank Fritz jumps for joy as he and Mike Wolfe pick a recently closed toy museum that is ready to sell its collection of treasures.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard uncovers an unusual chair in an outbuilding of Lemmington Hall in Alnwick, Northumberland. Later, he visits a traditional Welsh country house with an interesting interior.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Bitesize
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard Pembroke, where he finds an old church that has been converted into an antiques store with a varied selection.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including MIddlesbrough v Leeds United and Fulham v Swansea City.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Detectives search for a missing nine-year-old girl who disappeared from her bed in the middle of the night - and consider someone close to home as one of the suspects.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Why crimes in which there is no personal connection between the killer and victim may remain unsolved for years.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The story of a woman who told police her mother and brother had been killed by Albanian thieves, but whose cruel plan was uncovered when her alibi fell apart.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from Oklahoma, where the Long Branch Saloon was the local hangout for many in the small town of Poteau. However, its beloved proprietor Joe Neff went missing in 2009, leaving behind a splatter of blood. His body was later retrieved from an old mining strip pit, but the identity of his killer remained a mystery.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The FBI are called in when a bank manager is unable to open the vault, revealing a sophisticated burglary with losses of $8million.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The team makes a dramatic rescue when a spaniel gets trapped underground. Plus, a challenging situation arises when a dog and her pups are attacked by bees.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Peter needs to remove a grass seed from a dog's eye. Dr Alex tries to fix a traumatised puppy that has been attacked and a massive dog comes in for a check-up.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Leah, a former model, is assigned to consultant Dianne, who is challenged by her opinionated maid-of-honour.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Eternal bridesmaid Brittany, now the bride, wants to 'drop it low' in a dress. Erika plans to wear her old wedding dress down the aisle - with a different fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride wants a glittery gown, which may not be practical for a wedding in Cyprus, and a customer looks for a mermaid dress so she can renew her vows.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A mini pig who loves to dig is in trouble with local authorities, a homeless shih-tzu cross is in a critical condition, and a baby cheetah must pass a series of tests.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A team of investigators responds to reports of animal cruelty, rescuing pets and dealing with abusive owners.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Animal Cruelty Investigators arrive at a property to rescue some horses, but have a surprise in store when they discover a litter of puppies trapped inside a storm drain.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades rummage through the homes of impressionist Jon Culshaw and comedian Mark Dolan, in the hunt for items they can upcycle to raise money for charity.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How science is helping police establish links between contract killers and their employers.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of high-profile district attorney Ray Gricar, who went missing from his home area of Pennsylvania in April 2005. His laptop and hard drive were found destroyed in the Susquehanna River, leaving detectives wondering whether he had been murdered or gone on the run.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Sherrill Levitt, Suzie Streeter and Stacy McCall who vanished from their home in Springfield, Missouri, in June 1992. Sherrill was Suzie's mother, while Stacy was her friend and the disappearance happened a day after Suzie and Stacy had graduated from high school.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: A case from May 1997, when eight-year-old Jamie Lavis was on the Manchester bus Darren Vickers was driving just prior to his disappeance. Vickers joined the hunt and spoke on television - but was hiding an awful truth. Bones from Jamie's torso were eventually found hidden in bushes on a golf course five months later, and evidence led detectives back to the driver.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: David and Danielle assist fussy bride Katie, who has fruitlessly tried on countless dresses, and Antonia who has a long list of what she doesn't want on a wedding dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Laura wants a frock to rock with her favourite leather jacket, and steam punk bride Julia needs a dress she can wear to the ceremony on a motorbike.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: David helps a bride recovering from a brain illness who suffers a lack of confidence over the weight she has gained, while another customer clashes with her mother.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride returns to the shop for her first fitting, and a customer disagrees with her mother about the style of her dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride comes to the shop from Dubai in search of her dream dress, and another customer is determined that her princess-style gown should be just right.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride faces opposition from her sister and sister-in-law over her choice of gown, while another customer knows what she wants, but fears her mother will not agree.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits an old manor house in Wales and discovers forgotten treasures in its attic, and also views street art in Norfolk.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades rummage through the homes of impressionist Jon Culshaw and comedian Mark Dolan, in the hunt for items they can upcycle to raise money for charity.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. At over 600lbs, Angie is trying to get to Houston to see Dr Now and get life-saving weight-loss surgery. However, a family conflict proves to be an obstacle.

programme.title: Long Lost Family Australia
programme.desc: Chrissie Swan and Anh Do host a heart-warming, emotional series shining a light on incredible true stories of people who have long sought out lost family members. Cancer sufferer Ray Hawkins is searching for his daughter, whom he abandoned during a difficult time over 40 years ago.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: A Tiger Ate My Face: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A man from Bangladesh who suffered facial injuries from being attacked by a tiger undergoes surgery to restore his features.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: When Robert O'Dubaine was found shot to death in 1993, an apparent gangland hit unravelled into a case of betrayal, which directed the FBI on a hunt for his fiancee Catherine Suh, a lethal temptress dubbed the Black Widow by the media.
